title: A Dual-Tier Adaptive One-Class Classification IDS for Emerging Cyberthreats
abstract: arXiv:2403.13010v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: In today's digital age, our dependence on IoT (Internet of Things) and IIoT (Industrial IoT) systems has grown immensely, which facilitates sensitive activities such as banking transactions and personal, enterprise data, and legal document exchanges. Cyberattackers consistently exploit weak security measures and tools. The Network Intrusion Detection System (IDS) acts as a primary tool against such cyber threats. However, machine learning-based IDSs, when trained on specific attack patterns, often misclassify new emerging cyberattacks. Further, the limited availability of attack instances for training a supervised learner and the ever-evolving nature of cyber threats further complicate the matter. This emphasizes the need for an adaptable IDS framework capable of recognizing and learning from unfamiliar/unseen attacks over time. translated_title: 一种针对新兴网络威胁的双层自适应单类分类入侵检测系统
translated_abstract: 在当今数字时代，我们对物联网（IoT）和工业物联网（IIoT）系统的依赖日益增长，这有助于进行银行交易、个人、企业数据和法律文件交换等敏感活动。网络入侵检测系统（IDS）作为一种主要工具用于防范这类网络威胁。然而，基于机器学习的IDS，在针对特定攻击模式进行训练时，常常会错误地对新兴网络攻击进行分类。此外，用于训练监督学习器的攻击实例有限，网络威胁不断演变的特性进一步加剧了问题。这凸显了需要一种能够随着时间识别并学习来自陌生/未知攻击的适应性IDS框架的需求。在这项研究中，我们提出了一个基于两个层次结构的单类分类驱动的IDS系统。
tldr: 提出了一种双层结构的自适应单类分类入侵检测系统，能够适应识别和学习来自未知攻击的特性。
